info.title: eCommerce Marketing Mailchimp
info.description: Mailchimp helps small businesses do big things, with the right tools and guidance every step of the way.

get.description: Get information about an account's orders.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `campaign_id` value.

parameters.name: outreach_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `outreach_id` value.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders made by a specific customer.

parameters.name: has_outreach
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders that have an outreach attached. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

schema.title: Orders
schema.description: A collection of orders in an account.

orders.title: Orders
orders.description: An array of objects, each representing an order resource.

items.title: E-commerce Order
items.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

store_id.title: Store Foreign ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total associated with an order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total associated with an order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The Mailchimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed in ISO 8601 format.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.

shipping_address.title: Shipping Address
shipping_address.description: The shipping address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's shipping address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The shipping address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the shipping address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the order's shipping address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state the order's shipping address is located in.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the order's shipping address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the order's shipping address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the shipping address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the shipping address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the order's shipping address

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with an order's shipping address.

billing_address.title: Billing Address
billing_address.description: The billing address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's billing address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The billing address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the billing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the billing address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the billing address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state in the billing address.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the billing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the billing address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the billing address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the billing address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the billing address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the billing address.

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with the billing address.

promos.title: Promos
promos.description: The promo codes applied on the order

amount_discounted.title: Amount Discounted
amount_discounted.description: The amount of discount applied on the total price. For example if the total cost was $100 and the customer paid $95.5, amount_discounted will be 4.5 For free shipping set amount_discounted to 0

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed

lines.title: Order Line Items
lines.description: An array of the order's line items.

items.title: E-commerce Order Line Item
items.description: Information about a specific order line.

id.title: Order Line Item Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for an order line item.

product_id.title: Order Line Item Product Foreign ID
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with an order line item.

product_title.title: Order Line Item Product Title
product_title.description: The name of the product for an order line item.

product_variant_id.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Foreign ID
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with an order line item.

product_variant_title.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Title
product_variant_title.description: The name of the product variant for an order line item.

image_url.title: Product Image URL
image_url.description: The image URL for a product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The order line item quantity.

price.title: Price
price.description: The order line item price.

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: The total discount amount applied to a line item.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about all stores in the account.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

schema.title: E-commerce Stores
schema.description: A collection of stores in the account.

items.title: E-commerce Store
items.description: An individual store in an account.

id.title: Store Foreign ID
id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique identifier for the [Mailchimp List](/developer/reference/lists/) that's associated with the store. The `list_id` for a specific store can't change.

name.title: Store Name
name.description: The name of the store.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The e-commerce platform of the store.

domain.title: Domain

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about a store's carts.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

schema.title: Carts
schema.description: A collection of a store's carts.

carts.title: E-commerce Store Carts
carts.description: An array of objects, each representing a cart.

items.title: E-commerce Cart
items.description: Information about a specific cart.

id.title: Cart Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID

orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

get.description: Get information about a store's customers.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: Restrict the response to customers with the email address.

schema.title: Customers
schema.description: A collection of the store's customers.

customers.title: Customers
customers.description: An array of objects, each representing a customer of a store.

items.title: E-commerce Customer
items.description: Information about a specific customer.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

get.description: Get information about a store's promo rules.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

schema.title: Promo Rules
schema.description: A collection of the store's promo rules.

promo_rules.title: Promo Rules
promo_rules.description: An array of objects, each representing promo rules defined for a store.

items.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
items.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule

id.title: Promo Rule Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.title: Title

target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled

type.title: Problem Type

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length of 100 bytes.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.
description.example: Save BIG during our summer sale!

starts_at.title: Promo Start Time
starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.title: End Time
ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title

status.title: HTTP Status Code

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about a store's promo codes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: promo_rule_id
parameters.description: The id for the promo rule of a store.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

schema.title: Promo Codes
schema.description: A collection of the store's promo codes.

promo_codes.title: Promo Codes
promo_codes.description: An array of objects, each representing promo codes defined for a store.

items.title: E-commerce Promo Code
items.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Code

id.title: Promo Code Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the promo Code.

code.title: Promo Code
code.description: The discount code. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

redemption_url.title: Redemption Url
redemption_url.description: The url that should be used in the promotion campaign restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 2000.
redemption_url.example: A url that applies promo code directly at checkout or a url that points to sale page or store url

usage_count.title: Promo Code Usage Count
usage_count.description: Number of times promo code has been used.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo code is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

schema.title: E-commerce Promo Code
schema.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Code.

code.title: Promo Code
code.description: The discount code. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

redemption_url.title: Redemption Url
redemption_url.description: The url that should be used in the promotion campaign restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 2000.
redemption_url.example: A url that applies promo code directly at checkout or a url that points to sale page or store url

usage_count.title: Promo Code Usage Count
usage_count.description: Number of times promo code has been used.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo code is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about a store's orders.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders made by a specific customer.

parameters.name: has_outreach
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders that have an outreach attached. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `campaign_id` value.

parameters.name: outreach_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders with a specific `outreach_id` value.

schema.title: Orders
schema.description: A collection of orders in a store.

store_id.title: Store ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

orders.title: Orders
orders.description: An array of objects, each representing an order in a store.

items.title: E-commerce Order
items.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Orders) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

store_id.title: Store Foreign ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total associated with an order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total associated with an order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The Mailchimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed in ISO 8601 format.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.

shipping_address.title: Shipping Address
shipping_address.description: The shipping address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's shipping address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The shipping address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the shipping address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the order's shipping address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state the order's shipping address is located in.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the order's shipping address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the order's shipping address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the shipping address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the shipping address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the order's shipping address

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with an order's shipping address.

billing_address.title: Billing Address
billing_address.description: The billing address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's billing address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The billing address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the billing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the billing address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the billing address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state in the billing address.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the billing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the billing address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the billing address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the billing address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the billing address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the billing address.

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with the billing address.

promos.title: Promos
promos.description: The promo codes applied on the order

amount_discounted.title: Amount Discounted
amount_discounted.description: The amount of discount applied on the total price. For example if the total cost was $100 and the customer paid $95.5, amount_discounted will be 4.5 For free shipping set amount_discounted to 0

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed

lines.title: Order Line Items
lines.description: An array of the order's line items.

items.title: E-commerce Order Line Item
items.description: Information about a specific order line.

id.title: Order Line Item Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for an order line item.

product_id.title: Order Line Item Product Foreign ID
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with an order line item.

product_title.title: Order Line Item Product Title
product_title.description: The name of the product for an order line item.

product_variant_id.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Foreign ID
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with an order line item.

product_variant_title.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Title
product_variant_title.description: The name of the product variant for an order line item.

image_url.title: Product Image URL
image_url.description: The image URL for a product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The order line item quantity.

price.title: Price
price.description: The order line item price.

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: The total discount amount applied to a line item.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

post.description: Add a new order to a store.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

schema.title: E-commerce Order
schema.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. For existing customers include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign for an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The total for the order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total for the order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The Mailchimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed in ISO 8601 format.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled in ISO 8601 format. Note: passing a value for this parameter will cancel the order being created.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The id for the order in a store.

schema.title: E-commerce Order
schema.description: Information about a specific order.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing Mailchimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your Mailchimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Customers).

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](/developer/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#Order_Notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total associated with an order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total associated with an order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The Mailchimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed in ISO 8601 format.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled in ISO 8601 format. Note: passing a value for this parameter will cancel the order being edited.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.

shipping_address.title: Shipping Address
shipping_address.description: The shipping address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's shipping address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The shipping address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the shipping address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the order's shipping address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state the order's shipping address is located in.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the order's shipping address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the order's shipping address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the shipping address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the shipping address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the order's shipping address

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with an order's shipping address.

billing_address.description: The billing address for the order.

promos.title: Promos

amount_discounted.title: Amount Discounted

type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed

province.title: Province

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about a store's products.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The store id.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about a product's variants.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.description: The store id.

get.description: Get information about a product's images.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
